TopicTitle: Is there any trick to making a persistent file into a scenario?

Articles.Content:
I'm in the middle of constructing a scenario for part of a Challenge I'm going to submit shortly.

There doesn't seem to be any info on how to change your persistant file to a scenario: is there any trick to it?

Thanks for any help,

Sam

Just the folder the .sfs goes in I think, and you can add your own description and banner. The main difference is the scenario .sfs isn't altered, if the player changes something/saves it makes a new sub-folder and .sfs so you can always reset to the original scenario.

The "scene = 5" that's in the persistence file and "scene = 7" that's in the stock scenario's doesn't seem to do anything, and all the rest appears to be the same. I tried changing some of the "CanGoInVAB" type stuff to false and couldn't make it work. My persistence.sfs worked perfectly as a scenario, I just added a description and .png with the same name for the banner.
